CatDescriptText: Paul Quick, mill worker, 7 Davenport Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 7, 1959, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think that the Wacs and others women's units, with the exception of nurses, should be abolished in armed services during peacetime? Why?" answer reads: "I think that the children are the rulers, and simply because the parents let them rule."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Paul Quick wearing moustache, dark zippered jacket with collar and pockets, and hat, standing in front of stone block half wall with metal railing, billboard inscribed "pay your...promptly..." on building in background
